title: 111_hr4973
content: The "National Wildlife Refuge Volunteer Improvement Act of 2010" authorizes appropriations for volunteer, community partnership, and education programs under the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956. The Act specifies $2,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2011 to 2014 for these purposes. Additionally, technical corrections are made to the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956 regarding the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966. The National Wildlife Refuge System Volunteer and Community Partnership Enhancement Act of 1998 is being amended to establish a National Volunteer Coordination Program under the Secretary of the Interior. This program will be in line with the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956 and focus on gifts, volunteer services, community partnerships, and refuge education enhancement. The Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service will implement a National Volunteer Coordination Program within the National Wildlife Refuge System to support resource management, conservation, and public education programs. This program aims to provide opportunities for volunteers to assist in fulfilling the purpose and mission of the National Wildlife Refuge System. The Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service will establish a national strategy for volunteer coordination within the National Wildlife Refuge System, in consultation with relevant stakeholders. This includes providing regional volunteer coordinators to support the utilization of volunteers. The United States Fish and Wildlife Service will appoint regional volunteer coordinators to implement volunteer projects and activities under cooperative agreements. Amendments to the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956 include extending funding for volunteer programs through fiscal year 2014. The Secretary of the Interior will submit a report every 5 years evaluating volunteer programs and making recommendations for improvement. The National Wildlife Refuge System Volunteer and Community Partnership Enhancement Act of 1998 is being amended to implement specific subparagraphs and redesignate paragraphs.
